response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose of this measure is to establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. [CHUNK_2] This bill also repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund and lapses all unencumbered funds to the new fund. [CHUNK_3] The measure also intends to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_3]",
  "appropriations": "The provided documents state that a purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_3] However, no specific dollar amount for the appropriation is mentioned in the latest committee report. [CHUNK_3]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The latest committee report does not contain information regarding the assumptions and methodology used for financial projections. [CHUNK_0]",
  "agency_impact": "The latest committee report does not contain any new information regarding the agency impact of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "economic_impact": "The latest committee report does not contain any new information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "policy_impact": "The latest committee report does not contain any new information regarding the policy impact of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "revenue_sources": "The latest committee report reaffirms that the measure will lapse all unencumbered funds from the repealed revolving funds to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_3]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The latest committee report does not contain information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The latest committee report does not contain any new information regarding the operating revenue impact of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The latest committee report does not contain information regarding any capital expenditure impact. [CHUNK_0]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The latest committee report does not contain information regarding the fiscal implications after six years. [CHUNK_0]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The previous fiscal note was based on the text of H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1. [CHUNK_1] The new document, HSCR862, is a report from the Committee on Finance which received testimony in support of the measure from the University of Hawaiʻi System. [CHUNK_4] The Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, and recommends that it pass Third Reading, but the report itself does not introduce any new fiscal changes or amendments. [CHUNK_5]",
  "fte_positions": "The latest committee report does not mention the addition or modification of any FTE positions. [CHUNK_0]",
  "appropriations_changes": "The latest committee report does not specify a dollar amount for the appropriation, which is consistent with the previous version of the bill. [CHUNK_3]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "The latest committee report does not indicate any changes to the funding sources for this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "department_impact": "The latest committee report does not indicate any changes to the department responsible for this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "reports_required": "The latest committee report does not contain any new information regarding reporting requirements. [CHUNK_0]",
  "pilot_program": "The latest committee report does not establish a pilot program. [CHUNK_0]",
  "sunset_date": "The latest committee report does not contain a sunset date for the bill or program. [CHUNK_0]",
  "effective_date": "The latest committee report does not contain any information regarding the effective date of the measure. [CHUNK_0]"
}

{
  "overview": "The purpose of this measure is to establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. [CHUNK_2] This bill also repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund and lapses all unencumbered funds to the new fund. [CHUNK_3] The measure also intends to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_3]",
  "appropriations": "The provided documents state that a purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [CHUNK_3] However, no specific dollar amount for the appropriation is mentioned in the latest committee report. [CHUNK_3]",

  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The latest committee report does not contain information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [CHUNK_0]",

  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The latest committee report does not contain information regarding the fiscal implications after six years. [CHUNK_0]",

[CHUNK_1] The new document, HSCR862, is a report from the Committee on Finance which received testimony in support of the measure from the University of Hawaiʻi System. No. 1169, H.D. 1, and recommends that it pass Third Reading, but the report itself does not introduce any new fiscal changes or amendments. [CHUNK_5]",

Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madame: Your Committee on Finance, to which was referred H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, entitled: "A

which was referred H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose of this measure is to: (1) Establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration

of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System; (2) Repeal the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund and lapse all

and Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund and lapse all unencumbered funds to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund; and (3) Appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. Your Committee received testimony in support of this measure from the University of Hawai ʻ

support of this measure from the University of Hawai ʻ i System. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Finance that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, and

intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, and recommends that it pass Third Reading. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Finance, ____________________________ KYLE T. YAMASHITA, Chair

overview.prompt: Using the provided legislative documents, statutes, and testimonies, write a clear summary describing the purpose, scope, and key components of the proposed measure or bill, including any pilot or permanent programs, reporting requirements, and sunset clauses. This should be around 3 sentences.
overview.description: General overview and summary of the measure

appropriations.prompt: Based on budgetary data and legislative appropriations, detail the funding allocated for the program or measure, including fiscal years, amounts, intended uses such as staffing, training, contracts, technology, etc... This should be around 3 sentences.

assumptions_and_methodology.prompt: Explain the assumptions, cost estimation methods, and data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this program or measure, referencing comparable programs or historical budgets where applicable. This should be around 3 sentences.

agency_impact.prompt: Describe the anticipated operational, administrative, and budgetary impact of the program or measure on the relevant government agency or department, including supervision, staffing, and resource allocation. This should be around 3 sentences.
agency_impact.description: Impact on government agencies and departments

economic_impact.prompt: Summarize the expected economic effects of the program or measure, such as cost savings, potential reductions in related expenditures, benefits to the community, and any relevant performance or participation statistics. This should be around 3 sentences.

policy_impact.prompt: Analyze the policy implications of the measure, including how it modifies existing laws or programs, its role within broader legislative strategies, and its potential effects on state or local governance. This should be around 3 sentences.

revenue_sources.prompt: Identify and describe the funding sources that will support the program or measure, such as general funds, grants, fees, or other revenue streams, based on the provided fiscal documents. This should be around 3 sentences.

six_year_fiscal_implications.prompt: Provide a multi-year fiscal outlook (e.g., six years) for the program or measure, projecting costs, staffing changes, recurring expenses, and assumptions about program expansion or permanence using available budget and workload data. This should be around 10 sentences.

operating_revenue_impact.prompt: Describe any anticipated impacts on operating revenues resulting from the program or measure, including increases, decreases, or changes in revenue streams. This should be around 3 sentences.

capital_expenditure_impact.prompt: Outline any expected capital expenditures related to the program or measure, such as investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure, based on capital budgets or agency plans. This should be around 3 sentences.

fiscal_implications_after_6_years.prompt: Summarize the ongoing fiscal obligations after the initial multi-year period for the program or measure, including annual operating costs, expected number of program sites or units, and the sustainability of funding. This should be around 3 sentences.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years.description: Long-term fiscal obligations beyond six years

updates_from_previous_fiscal_note.prompt: If you are given a previous fiscal note. Please summarize the MAIN POINTS that are different from the previous fiscal note and the new fiscal note.

fte_positions.prompt: Detail any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions that have been added or modified in this version of the bill, including the number of positions, their roles, and any changes from previous versions. This should be around 3 sentences.

appropriations_changes.prompt: Identify and describe any appropriations that were previously unspecified or have been modified between versions of the bill, including the amounts and purposes of the appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
appropriations_changes.description: Changes to appropriations between bill versions

funding_sources_changes.prompt: Specify the method of funding (MOF) for appropriations and identify any changes in funding sources between versions, such as shifts between general fund and special fund appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
funding_sources_changes.description: Changes to funding sources and method of funding

department_impact.prompt: Describe any changes in which department is responsible for expending appropriations, including shifts from one department to another between bill versions (e.g., from Department of Health to Judiciary). This should be around 3 sentences.
department_impact.description: Changes in department responsibility for appropriations

reports_required.prompt: Identify any reports that agencies are required to submit to the legislature, including new reporting requirements or modifications to existing ones. This should be around 3 sentences.

pilot_program.prompt: If the bill creates a pilot program, describe the length of the pilot program and whether it was initially intended to be a pilot program or a permanent program. This should be around 3 sentences.

sunset_date.prompt: Identify the sunset date for the bill or program, including any modifications to the sunset date between versions. This should be around 2 sentences.

effective_date.prompt: Identify the effective date of the bill, noting if there was a defective effective date in a previous version and what the corrected effective date is. This should be around 2 sentences.
